etymologies: late Middle English: from Latin explanare, based on planus ‘plain’

definitions: make (an idea, situation, or problem) clear to someone by describing it in more detail or revealing relevant facts or ideas

examples.text: they explained that their lives centered on the religious rituals

shortDefinitions: make idea or situation clear to someone by describing it in more detail

definitions: account for (an action or event) by giving a reason as excuse or justification

examples.text: Callie found it necessary to explain her blackened eye
he makes athletes explain why they made a mistake
she had tried to explain about Adam, hadn't she?

shortDefinitions: give reason so as to justify or excuse

definitions: be the cause of or motivating factor for

examples.text: her father's violence explains her pacificism
this would explain why so many adult children still live with their parents

shortDefinitions: be cause of or motivating factor for

definitions: minimize the significance of an embarrassing fact or action by giving an excuse or justification

examples.text: they know stories about me that I can't explain away

shortDefinitions: minimize significance of embarrassing fact or action by giving excuse or justification
